page.title: 02BREAN DOWN FARM
page.content: BREAN DOWN FARM,SIMILAR TO OTHER FARMS IN THE AREA IS USED AS A DAIRY FARM.MR.VOWELS TYPICAL SOMERSET FARMER OWNS 245 ACRES OF WHICH 45 ACRES ARE SALT MARSH.HE OWNS 200 FREISIARS AND EMPLOYS TWO FARM HANDS.THE FARM WAS ORIGINALLY PART OF WINDHAN ESTATE AND PREVIOUSLY MENTIONED IN THE ORIGINAL DOMESDAY BOOK.THEN BOUGHT BY MR.VOWLES FATHER IN 1956.THE ORIGIAL FARMHOUSE WAS BUILT FROM MENDIP LIMESTONE ALTHOUGH NEWER BUILDINGS WERE BUILT IN LATE 1971 FROM RED BRICK.THE FARM BACKS ONTO THE RIVER AXE AND DUE TO HIS FARM BEING BELOW SEA LEVEL THERE WAS NEED FOR SEA DEFENCES.THE MONKS FROM GLASTONBURY BUILT THE FIRST SEA DEFENCES IN THE FARM OFF A RAISED BANK. THIS WAS LATER STENGTHED BY THE ADDITION OF CONCRETE,AND THE BUILDING OF NEW WALL,BY WESSEX WATER AUTHORITY.
